doc:
Lee Tung Foo https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Tung_Foo 0 Lee Tung Foo (also known as Frank Lee) was a Chinese American Vaudeville performer born in California who performed in English, German, and Latin. He became a film actor later in his life. At the age of 45, he ran a Chinese restaurant he bought in New York City called Jung Sy Mandarin Restaurant. He opened a second restaurant, Imig Sy, and both were strategically placed near Broadway. By the 1930s he returned to theater work, playing some minor roles until 1932, when he was cast as Wang Yun in the film, The Skull Murder Mystery. He continued with minor roles, being cast as the servant of the Detective, Mr. Wong, in the 1939 film The Mystery of Mr. Wong. His last work was in The Manchurian Candidate, an uncredited role at the age of 87. Lee_Tung_Foo ( also_known as Frank_Lee ) was a_Chinese_American_Vaudeville_performer born in California who performed in English , German , and Latin . He became a_film_actor later in his_life . At the_age of 45 , he ran a_Chinese_restaurant he bought in New_York_City called Jung_Sy_Mandarin_Restaurant . He opened a_second_restaurant , Imig_Sy , and both were_strategically_placed near Broadway . By the_1930s he returned to theater_work , playing some_minor_roles until 1932 , when he was_cast as Wang_Yun in the_film , The_Skull_Murder_Mystery . He continued with minor_roles , being_cast as the_servant of the_Detective , Mr._Wong , in the_1939_film The_Mystery of Mr._Wong . His_last_work was in The_Manchurian_Candidate , an_uncredited_role at the_age of 87 .
